summary.para: The IP_PER_ADAPTER_INFO structure contains information specific to a particular adapter.

remarks.para: APIPA enables automatic IP address configuration on networks without DHCP servers, using the IANA-reserved Class B network 169.254.0.0, with a subnet mask of 255.255.0.0. Clients send ARP messages to ensure the selected address is not currently in use. Clients auto-configured in this fashion continue to poll for a valid DHCP server every five minutes, and if found, the DHCP server configuration overrides all auto-configuration settings.

summary.para: Specifies whether IP address auto-configuration (APIPA) is enabled on this adapter. See Remarks.
Specifies whether this adapter's IP address is currently auto-configured by APIPA.
Reserved. Use the DnsServerList member to obtain the DNS servers for the local computer.
A linked list of structures that specify the set of DNS servers used by the local computer.
